page.title: 14Village Church,Slitting Mill
page.content: If you walk along Church Close you will find the {Church of St. John the Baptist} which was built in 1871.It is unusual because it is attached to a house. Inside it is quite small and very cosy. There is a weekly service usually unaccompanied, although the church has a harmonium. At the east end there are three stained glass windows showing Jesus, Mary and John. There are fourteen pews. Mainly people from Slitting Mill village go to the services. There are not enough children to have a Sunday School. The bell rings every Sunday morning and can be heard by the whole village.
